biography: Writer/Director/Producer - Jason DaSilva:Emmy-winning filmmaker Jason DaSilva's first collaborative feature film was Cuba Dreams, shot in Havana in 1999 and screened at the Latin America Film Festival in Cuba later that year. His next film, Olivia's Puzzle, screened at more than 30 festivals including Sundance, received an Oscar qualification in the summer of 2003 and was broadcast on HBO and PBS in 2004. His third film, the feature documentary, Lest We Forget, premiered at the International Documentary Festival of Amsterdam in 2004, and his film A Song for Daniel screened at the Tribeca Film Festival in 2005 and PBS in 2005. His most recent short film, Twins Of Mankala, premiered at Tribeca Film Festival and aired on PBS in 2006. DaSilva returned to his passion for new media and interdisciplinary art, showing his time-based artwork at galleries internationally and at the Whitney Biennial in 2006. DaSilva's latest film production, When I Walk, appeared at the Sundance Film Festival in 2013 and was broadcast on PBS/POV the following year. The film won an Emmy award for non-fiction television in 2015. He has also established AXS Lab - a non-profit with a mission to serve people with MS and other disabilities through media awareness and advocacy. AXSMap is a trans-media project supported by Google and other foundations to help the disability community find accessible locations throughout the world.

biography: Jerry Willoughby is a Columbia College Chicago graduate, where he majored in Film. He found more interest in comic books than moving pictures. Jerry successfully Kickstarted his first graphic novel, "Lucky" which was picked up for publishing by Creator's Edge. His work can be seen in the Alterna IF crime anthology and the forthcoming Psychedelic Journal. He has written two webcomics illustrated by his wife. He also writes comics for Zeda labs. Jerry is a new father and has mastered the art of script writing with one hand while changing a diaper with the other.
name: Jerry Willoughby
